Lighting Supervisor - Turn 10 Studios

Turn 10 Studios, the creators of the top selling and critically acclaimed Forza Motorsport franchise, has an exciting opportunity for an experienced Lighting Supervisor to join the Art Department. As a Lighting Supervisor, you will be responsible for defining and driving lighting techniques to achieve state of the art game content. You will apply a deep and thorough understanding of lighting techniques and a strong sense of color and mood to execute our challenging visual targets. The Lighting Supervisor should be a good communicator who can drive the requisite implementation, training, and execution of a modern lighting pipeline by a group of talented Developers and Artists.

Responsibilities:

Collaborate with VFX Supervisor, Art Director and Technical Leads to define and implement a lighting solution and techniques to meet demanding visual targets

Participate in pre-production planning to determine lighting pipeline and workflow requirements

Direct the lighting for in-game cars and environments to showcase stunning visuals

Troubleshoot and solve lighting production issues

Work with programming and tools teams to develop tools/scripts/plugins to streamline lighting pipeline

Train a team of on-site and remote artists in the skills necessary to execute the lighting strategy, including delivering documentation of tools and workflow

Strive to maximize art production performance and predictability

Qualifications:

5 or more years of production experience creating real-time, next generation games

Preferred:

State of the art knowledge of current lighting techniques using offline software renderers (V-Ray preferred) and demonstrated mastery of advanced real-time lighting techniques

Experience with color grading and effects compositing Ability to articulate technical needs related to lighting, color, mood and contrast

A strong understanding of next-generation content creation techniques

Experience optimizing lighting on massive scenes for real-time performance considerations

Strong knowledge of one or more major 3D animation packages, 3D Studio Max preferred

Excellent organizational, communication, and interpersonal skills

Work well under deadlines and multi-tasks

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. Art Outsourcing Lead - Turn 10 Studios

Turn 10 Studios, the creators of the Forza Motorsport franchise and a division of Microsoft Game Studios, has an exciting opportunity for an experienced Art Outsourcing Lead.

The successful candidate possesses 5 years of experience in a similar Outsourcing role, excellent communication skills, and can manage cross-disciplinary teams.

The Outsourcing Lead will serve as the main point of contact for the external partner and must coordinate cross-functional internal resources, third party/vendors and involve all relevant stakeholders to successfully execute the program. The candidate will work directly with Art Directors, Art Leads and Producers to drive the external content creation of environments, vehicles, characters and other relevant assets. The candidate is responsible and accountable for strategy, execution and management of all outsourcing and contracting activities with our Business Team to manage SOWs, contracts, tests. Candidates must be willing to travel up to 20%.

Responsibilities:

• At a project level, help to plan and maintain the distributed development production plan, including resource management

• As the primary partner contact, manage partner relations and provide production troubleshooting for both partner and client teams.

• At the studio level, contribute to our overall distributed development strategy, organize Vendor tests and overall roadmap.

• Identifies trends and opportunities to significantly increase resourcing scalability, reduced production bottlenecks and dependencies.

• Perform risk management analyses to minimize/mitigate project risks using appropriate tools and techniques

• Lead contract negotiations for the Studio to assure contract terms and conditions are clearly defined, understood, and acceptable.

Minimum Qualifications:

• 5+ years of experience in outsourcing management in an entertainment industry (experience in the games industry preferred)

Preferred Knowledge and Skills:

• Applicants experienced in software tracking tools and managing the progress of multiple projects

• Applicants with strong communication skills

• Staffing, Planning, People Management, Managing Profitability, Promoting Process Improvement, Financial Planning and Strategy, Strategic Planning, Dealing with Complexity, Analyzing Information, 3D Art Authoring Tools and Pipeline Knowledge and Experience

Other Knowledge and Skills:

• Demonstrated ability to decompose complex problems into actionable elements

• Microsoft Office (Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio)

• Art Software experience *Bonus if candidate understands 3DS Max, Maya, Photoshop Etc Art and Software tracking tools - Shotgun, TFS, Jira, ConceptShare

• Ability to travel 20% of the time Excellent verbal and written communication skills

• Excellent customer facing and internal communication skills.

• Solid organizational skills including attention to detail and multi-tasking skills

• Excellent people skills; a demonstrated ability to lead people and get results

Software Engineer - Turn 10 Studios

Are you a current or aspiring Software Engineer who loves gaming? Are you passionate about delivering high-scale engineering systems and services to help artists, designers, and engineers be more productive? Do you want to work in a AAA game studio and be on the cutting edge of 4K gaming on Xbox and PC? Then polish your resume and send it in quick because this job won’t last long!

Turn 10 Studios, makers of the critically acclaimed Forza series (Forza Motorsport 7 and Forza Horizons 3), is looking for a talented, self-motivated, software developer who is passionate about delivering high impact engineering systems and services that enable 400+ people worldwide to make the best 4K motorsports titles on Xbox and PC. We build highly scalable, business critical, distributed engineering systems and services that process terabytes of game content and code using hundreds of compute cores and GPUs to make games people love.

Turn 10 Studios is in a brand new, purpose built studio in Redmond Town Center, where we are part of a thriving gaming community with 343 Industries and Minecraft. If you’re ready to innovate, collaborate, and be a part of a studio that is passionate about delighting new and existing fans then apply today!

Basic Qualifications:

• 2+ years of delivering commercial software

• Bachelor’s Degree

Must-Haves:

• Mastery of delivering C++/C# and services

• Mastery of build and source control systems

• Commitment to quality and customer experiences

• A passion for gaming

Strong Pluses:

• Experience with build system components such as: MS compiler/linker, MSBuild, Incredibuild, Team City, VSTS, Perforce or Arxan software suites

• Experience with batch and PowerShell scripting languages

• An understanding of 3D graphics and game content creation tools (e.g. 3ds Max)

• Experience with Azure

Senior Design Director - Turn 10 Studios

Turn 10 Studios, creators of the award-winning Forza franchise, are looking for the right person to join our high-caliber team. At Turn 10 we make genre-leading racing games for Xbox and Windows, known for consistent innovation, authenticity and quality. Our vision is to grow Forza into the world’s leading brand for automotive entertainment. Come play a key role on our team and help us achieve this ambitious goal.

As the Design Director, you will guide our efforts to retain and diversify our passionate community of gamers and car fans through the Forza Motorsport franchise. Working closely with the Creative director and development team, you will design features and expand franchise reach.

To be successful in this role, you will need to combine a customer focus, acute analytical and leadership skills in order to solve ambiguous problems and target new markets.

Key Responsibilities:

•Set clear creative goals and deliverables with development team to ensure a cohesive experience across the game

•Anticipate threats/hurdles to vision, quality, and innovation and work effectively with team leads and development team to mitigate

•Prioritize and message content updates with internal and external teams

Capture and prioritize sustain features aimed and MAU and E-sport

•Work collaboratively with other teams within the Forza franchise including E-sports and community to align key goals

•Drive thought models and development direction for emerging markets

Basic Qualifications:

•5+ years’ experience in design as a Creative Director or Lead Designer

Required Skills and Traits:

•5+ years’ experience in design as a Creative Director or Lead Designer

•Minimum of 2 shipped AAA titles with at least one current console generation title.

•Previous experience with console/PC titles with at least one shipped AAA game

•Proven ability to conceptualize, communicate and guide the development of a game’s core pillars and narrative vision across a team

•Demonstrable background in hands-on evaluation and feedback of game mechanics

•Proven track record for delivering both quality and innovation.

•Ability to work and contribute effectively and collaboratively in a team environment

•Experience working with external development partners

•Passion for the gaming industry and an understanding of market trends and styles is a must.

•Experience with cars and automotive culture is a plus.

•Have a proactive work ethic, capable and creative problem solver who is not afraid of big challenges.

•Ability to multitask.

Xbox One racing games. Platform-defining server technology. The developer behind the highly acclaimed Forza Motorsport and Forza Horizon franchise, Turn 10 Studios, is looking for a rock star Software Design Engineer to help design and build the next great innovations in online and social gaming.

As a First-Party studio, this team works hand-in-hand with the Xbox One platform teams and Microsoft Studios to define gaming experiences across the Microsoft gaming ecosystem on Xbox One, Xbox Scorpio and Windows Store. You will help deliver the next AAA titles from Turn 10 Studios on next generation platforms.

We are constantly evolving our proven services architecture to improve performance, scalability and an expanding feature set supporting our games. We have a highly-skilled, fun, and passionate team of developers. We love what we do, yet we keep a strong work/life balance.

You must be comfortable dealing with ambiguous, challenging problems. Excellent communication skills are vital.

At least 5 years of professional software development experience

Turn 10 Studios, creators of the hit Forza Motorsport franchise, and a division of Microsoft Studios, is looking for a Partner Team Program Manager to help drive our Partner Programs and the team Rhythm of the Business.

Turn 10’s Partner team is focused on securing, managing and maintaining a third-party Partner portfolio that provides excitement, in-game content, marketing & promotional activation, co-branded experiences, and selected inbound license deals. Our thru-partner program delivers a promotional footprint that includes both social media as well as traditional co-marketing activities. We leverage our partners to support and drive the growing Forza franchise across geographies, audience types, and Forza products. Our partner types cover a wide range – including automobile manufacturers, major entertainment brands, other gaming franchise & brands, and major consumer brands.

We’re searching for an energized candidate to join our team, learn our business, and help support our growing footprint with a combination of project & organization skills supported by marketing / business development experience or comparable training & education.

The Partner Program Manager will work with the Lead to manage, organize, plan, support and follow through on team programs and rhythms. This will include driving the rhythm of the business, both team and selected external meetings & events, and maintaining the one source of our team projects, calendar, deliverables, resources needed, and other related items related to the projects at-hand.

The incumbent will interact with game production resources to track items related to partner projects. To support this, candidates should have communication and collaboration skills supporting this responsibility.

The Partner Program Manager may work with key partners & licensors from time to time, and thus must be able to collaborate with those partners to ensure their brands and intellectual property is accurately represented in our games and / or marketing & activation materials.

Success for this role includes a disciplined and predictable approach to execution that supports the timely launch of Forza titles, products and services and the incumbent schedules and dependencies.

Responsibilities:

Work with other team discipline project leads to ensure alignment

Compile partner program timelines, calendars, and weekly reports to keep the team updated on status and varying phases of execution of programs and projects

Keeping on track with Deliverables

Budget tracking

Tracking requested resources for Partner projects & initiatives

Facilitate collaborative and effective communication between team members across the studio

Develop process efficiencies & documentation

Identify risks and drive towards successful resolution before risks turn to roadblocks

Basic Qualifications:

2+ years of experience in one of these supporting disciplines – partner management, program management, franchise management, or marketing.

Your blend of skills and passion could come from a broad range of disciplines: program management, business development, marketing, or other related disciplines. The key requirements are:

Project management training and / or experience

Experience with licensed content

Ability to collaborate in a matrixed environment with various teams to drive projects to conclusion

Ability to plan, create and maintain a highly effective schedule

Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, and be a master at conflict resolution

Passion and energy

Preference for candidates who can work internationally, whether in-person or by phone or email on programs. This will include being available at various hours to accommodate partners, and taking into account cultural differences

Lead Concept Artist

Turn 10 Studios, the creators of the top selling and critically acclaimed Forza Motorsport franchise, has an exciting opportunity for a Lead Concept Artist to join our studio. Develop complex artistic elements that will constitute the artistic representation of ideas, provide inspiration and become references for the artistic direction of the project.

Responsibilities

• Collaborate with the art director to establish the style of the project and be a reference for all elements of art production (Environment, Character, UI etc.)

• Maintain consistent style under the direction of the Art Director and carry out revisions as required

• Set and share best practices, production pipelines and workflows within the group;

• Share knowledge and motivate artists within the team

• Be a reference for the art team in relation to various artistic elements and find solutions to complex issues that arise

• Efficiently communicate and support messages and decisions from management;

• Actively participate in the implementation of more efficient work methods;

• Plan, estimate and prioritize time frames for the completion of tasks and track progress using the designated tracking tools;

• Communicate and collaborate with key stakeholders to confirm task direction and ensure consistency of work within the team;

• Produce environment concept art, character concept art, and in-game mock ups, focusing particularly on lighting and post effects;

• Ensure a successful sign off process for own and others work by conducting reviews, critiquing work and providing suitable feedback;

• Effectively communicate complex visual intentions to the wider art team

• Support the Lead Artist and/or Art Director in any related ad hoc tasks.

Basic Qualifications:

• 5+ years of working with environment and character concept art

• At least 1 years’ experience of leading a team

Preferred Qualifications:

• Expert knowledge of Adobe Photoshop and familiarity with 3D packages and game engines

• Ability to create concepts of environments, characters and props to AAA standard

• At least 2 AAA shipped as a senior Concept Artist

• Advanced understanding of composition and lighting

• BA in Fine Arts (or similar area of study)

Release Manager - Turn 10 Studios

At Turn 10 Studios, our vision is to continue to grow Forza into the top automotive entertainment brand in the world. Our fans are what make this vision possible, and we are focused on delivering high-quality, timely games and updates to our ever-growing community on a continual basis. To deliver on this commitment, we are seeking a talented, proactive, quality-focused Producer to shepherd our game releases and to run our Release Management team.

This role collaborates with game and business teams to develop release plans that deliver fresh and exciting content to our players, all while identifying and mitigating risks along the way. As our catalog of products continues to grow, this individual will manage a team to scale with it, building best practices and instilling qualities that set them up for success.

This position will also develop great relationships with our partner teams to support our current releases, as well as driving the strategic needs of Turn 10. Successful candidates will have an eye for details, a commitment to delivering great customer experiences, and a passion for making amazing games.

Responsibilities:

• Work closely with product teams to understand full release schedule and business goals behind each release.

• Drive the release process end-to-end, including defining and reporting against milestones and key dates, holding reviews with stakeholders, preparing dependencies, and executing on plans.

• Clearly communicate issues, impact, and possible options as they arise, and develop action plans through partner collaboration.

• Identify risks in advance and drive the team towards successful resolution before the risks turn into incidents affecting the team or players.

• Develop and maintain a resourcing plan that accommodates the release management needs of the studio.

Basic Qualifications:

• 4+ years working in games industry, with experience managing releases.

Preferred Qualifications:

• Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making skills.

• Organized, with a great attention to detail.

• Ability to effectively communicate with anyone and partner with teams.

• Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience.
